detaileddescription.para: Check for usage of the C99 standard or PC-Lint in order to provide support of the static assertion functionality

memberdef.name: assert
memberdef.initializer: do{ if (!(expression)) { Assert_Dynamic((unsigned long)__LINE__,(unsigned char*)__FILE__); } } while (0)

detaileddescription.para: The program assertion macro implements an assertion, which can be used to verify assumptions made by the program and get notified of this information through a callback if this assumption is false and stop program execution. Program assertion is behaving differently in debug and release builds.

simplesect.para: Release builds must be built with the NDEBUG symbol defined.

parameterdescription.para: : A logical statement which can be true or false.

detaileddescription.para: This macro can't be used twice on the same LINE number. The user must ensure that even in header files the LINE number is always unique. Protect header files against multiple time inclusions and if possible put static assertions into C files instead of headers. The C99 standard does not support static assertions, nor the sizeof() keyword in preprocessor macros. To be able to perform compilation time variable size related checks, this macro is provided as a workaround. Note that the macro has some limitations.
Check if the int integer type is 4 bytes long, the following static assertion can be used:

parameterdescription.para: : A logical statement which can be true or false.
: A string about the test case - note that it is not compiled into the code.

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* Assert_Callback_T)(const unsigned long line, const unsigned char *const file)
memberdef.argsstring: )(const unsigned long line, const unsigned char *const file)
memberdef.name: Assert_Callback_T

briefdescription.para: This data type represents a function pointer which would be executed when an assertion is triggered.

simplesect.para: Ideally the first operation that is expected from the API implementing this functionality is to disable all the Interrupts of the system (based on the Hardware) and if required, it can trace / LOG the line number and filename from where the assertion came.

parameterdescription.para: : The line number of the source code from where the assert() is called.
: The file name of the source code from where the assert() is called.

memberdef.argsstring: (const unsigned long line, const unsigned char *const file)
memberdef.name: Assert_Dynamic

briefdescription.para: Dynamic assert function. The dynamic assert function calls a user mapped callback function (where atleast all the interrupts disabling is expected) and would freeze the system by entering an endless loop.

simplesect.para: Release builds must be built with the NDEBUG symbol defined. User shall not use this API and rather call the assert() macro with required assertion expression. Defining the ASSERT_USE_STD_EXIT macro in CFLAGS_DEBUG make variable would use the standard C exit() API.

parameterdescription.para: : The line number of the source code from where the assert() is called.
: The file name of the source code from where the assert() is called.

briefdescription.para: This function initializes the Assert module. It registers an assertion callback function. When an assertion is hit, registered callback function is called.

detaileddescription.para: Ideally, the first thing to be done in the callback function it to disable the interrupts of the system (hardware dependent). For trouble shooting, it can also trace / log the line number and filename from where the assertion came.

simplesect.para: Release builds must be built with the NDEBUG symbol defined. This API should be called before making use of any one of the assertion API's except for the static_assert().

parameterdescription.para: : A callback function which is executed when an assertion is triggered.

briefdescription.para: This function initializes the Assert module. It registers an assertion callback function. When an assertion is hit, registered callback function is called.

xrefdescription.para: since version vxx.xx.xx, replaced by Assert_Initialize

para.verbatim: Ideally, the first thing to be done in the callback function it to disable the interrupts of the system (hardware dependent). For trouble shooting, it can also trace / log the line number and filename from where the assertion came.

simplesect.para: Release builds must be built with the NDEBUG symbol defined. This API should be called before making use of any one of the assertion API's except for the static_assert().

parameterdescription.para: : A callback function which is executed when an assertion is triggered.

memberdef.argsstring: (void Assert_dynamic(const unsigned long line, const unsigned char *const file))
memberdef.name: BCDS_DEPRECATED

param.array: const unsigned long line, const unsigned char *const file

briefdescription.para: Dynamic assert function. The dynamic assert function calls a user mapped callback function (where atleast all the interrupts disabling is expected) and would freeze the system by entering an endless loop.

xrefdescription.para: since version vxx.xx.xx, replaced by Assert_Dynamic

simplesect.para: Release builds must be built with the NDEBUG symbol defined. User shall not use this API and rather call the assert() macro with required assertion expression. Defining the ASSERT_USE_STD_EXIT macro in CFLAGS_DEBUG make variable would use the standard C exit() API.

parameterdescription.para: : The line number of the source code from where the assert() is called.
: The file name of the source code from where the assert() is called.
